description: Digital roots of square numbers A000290.
comments: Cyclic with a period of nine. Note that (7, 9, 4, 1, 9, 1, 4, 9, 7) is palindromic.a(n) is also the decimal expansion of 499264730/333333333. - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Jul 28 2009a(n) is also the digital root of Demlo numbers (A002477). - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Dec 20 2009First above comment by _Enrique Pérez Herrero_ and his formula below give together the following identity: 1+Sum_{n>=2}(1+9*((n^2-1)/9-floor((n^2-1)/9)))/10^(n-1) = 499264730/333333333 = 1.49779419149779419149779419... - _Alexander R. Povolotsky_, Jun 14 2012
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Square Number.
mathematica: DigitalRoot[n_Integer?NonNegative] := 1 + 9*FractionalPart[(n - 1)/9] A056992[n_]:=DigitalRoot[n^2] (* _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Dec 20 2009 *)Table[FixedPoint[Total[IntegerDigits[#]]&,n^2],{n,90}] (* _Zak Seidov_, Jun 13 2015 *)
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
